title: First, rewrite our equation as $$2\left(2sin\left(\frac{\pi}{4}\right) cos\left(\frac{\pi}{4}\right)\right)$$.

Next, use the double-angle identity for sine: $$sin\left(2\theta\right)=2sin(theta)cos(theta)$$ to see that $$2sin\left(\frac{\pi}{4}\right) cos\left(\frac{\pi}{4}\right)=sin\left(\frac{\pi}{2}\right)$$
